item.title: [317] 100 Error Problem [317]
item.dc:creator: @_icestorm ~*icestorm*~
item.description:
@_icestorm wrote:

Im not sure if your using windows 7 but if you are use this @echo off if exist "%programfiles(x86)%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles(x86)%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles(x86)%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit I use windows 7 and this code works fine for me. If your not using windows 7 then your problem is probally what binladin305 said.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] 100 Error Problem [317]
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Now, I know that there is a compiling error fixing topic, but this is different and I didn’t understand it.

Here is my compiling code:

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Read full topic
